quotes.quote: The computing field is always in need of new cliches.
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.quote: Computers make it easier to do a lot of things, but most of the things they make it easier to do don't need to be done.
quotes.author: Andy Rooney

quotes.quote: The great thing about a computer notebook is that no matter how much you stuff into it, it doesn't get bigger or heavier.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: If computers get too powerful, we can organize them into a committee -- that will do them in.
quotes.author: Bradley's Bromide

quotes.quote: Why is it drug addicts and computer afficionados are both called users?
quotes.author: Clifford Stoll

quotes.quote: Home computers are being called upon to perform many new functions, including the consumption of homework formerly eaten by the dog.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
quotes.author: E. W. Dijkstra

quotes.quote: The question of whether a computer can think is no more interesting than the question of whether a submarine can swim.
quotes.author: E. W. Dijkstra

quotes.quote: Not even computers will replace committees, because committees buy computers.
quotes.author: Edward Shepherd Mead

quotes.quote: To err is human, but to really foul things up requires a computer.
quotes.author: Farmers' Almanac

quotes.quote: Compromise used to mean that half a loaf was better than no bread. Among modern statesmen it really seems to mean that half a loaf is better than a whole loaf.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: I do not fear computers. I fear the lack of them.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Computers can figure out all kinds of problems, except the things in the world that just don't add up.
quotes.author: James Magary

quotes.quote: Imagine if every Thursday your shoes exploded if you tied them the usual way. This happens to us all the time with computers, and nobody thinks of complaining.
quotes.author: Jef Raskin

quotes.quote: The most overlooked advantage to owning a computer is that if they foul up there's no law against wacking them around a little.
quotes.author: Joe Martin

quotes.quote: One would think that if you're anonymous, you'd do anything you want, but groups have their own sense of community and what we can do.
quotes.author: John Allen

quotes.quote: In all large corporations, there is a pervasive fear that someone, somewhere is having fun with a computer on company time. Networks help alleviate that fear.
quotes.author: John C. Dvorak

quotes.quote: There is no reason for any individual to have a computer in his home.
quotes.author: Ken Olsen

quotes.quote: The most likely way for the world to be destroyed, most experts agree, is by accident. That's where we come in; we're computer professionals. We cause accidents.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Borenstein

quotes.quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: The computer is a moron.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: If you put tomfoolery into a computer, nothing comes out of it but tomfoolery. But this tomfoolery, having passed through a very expensive machine, is somehow ennobled and no-one dares criticize it.
quotes.author: Pierre Gallois

quotes.quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
quotes.author: Rick Cook

quotes.quote: To err is human--and to blame it on a computer is even more so.
quotes.author: Robert Orben

quotes.quote: If the automobile had followed the same development cycle as the computer, a Rolls-Royce would today cost $100, get a million miles per gallon, and explode once a year, killing everyone inside.
quotes.author: Robert X. Cringely

quotes.quote: I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: All programmers are playwrights and all computers are lousy actors.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: In a few minutes a computer can make a mistake so great that it would have taken many men many months to equal it.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: Where a calculator on the ENIAC is equipped with 18,000 vacuum tubes and weighs 30 tons, computers in the future may have only 1,000 vaccuum tubes and perhaps weigh 1.5 tons.
quotes.author: unknown
